Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2011 03:16PM thePuppetLady wrote: signing in for the July rads.....had my sim/mapping done a couple of days ago and should have a schedule in about a week. Had a bit of a scare with the baseline mammo.  I asked them to do both breasts as I would be due in September and I won't feel like having a mammo then due to me prolly being like raw hamburger :(...they ended up calling me back for a redo because of an enlarged lymph node on my non-cancer side but on ultrasound it looked normal....whew....
Posts.Title: July 2011 rads Merilee jankc

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 09:20AM thePuppetLady wrote: sounds like cording to me...do you have like a tight "cord" running down your arm?  I had this after my node dissection and the surgeon said it would resolve in a few weeks (it's the lymphatic system reacting to the surgery or something).  The exercises do help (walking up a wall) and mine resolved pretty quickly :)
Posts.Title: Question about arm after surgery SStayton Kimberly1961

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2010 02:51PM thePuppetLady wrote: ..there are no dumb questions :)  You'll get a good idea how you'll respond after the first treatment.  I've just done my 2nd (Cytoxin and Taxotere) and I'm fine for a couple of days, then a mild flu-like feeling sets in for me, with a sore neck and then the fatigue, which is draining but manageable. Just see how you feel about driving.  I drive ok--I just make sure I'm not too tired.  They suggest that you have someone drive you for your chemo treatments as you may be a bit sleepy from the meds.  I actually drove myself for the 2nd treatment and it was a 40' drive and I was fine.. hang in there and check in and let us know how you're doing'....ellen
Posts.Title: Scheduled to have Chemo Nov. 3rd ChrisinSD lorrhaw

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2012 12:35AM thePuppetLady wrote: hi there, I had both.  I was told I had a "complete response" to the neoadjuvant chemo (Cytoxin/Taxotere) but then after my lumpectomy and node removal, my onco put me on adjuvant chemo (Navelbine/Xeloda).  I was distressed to have to do chemo again but was told since the surgeon found scattered bits of dying cancer thruout remaining breast tissue and due to node involvement, it was recommended for the extra "insurance". And I was pleasantly surprised how much easier the 2nd round of chemo was.  No loss of hair and some fatigue and oh, some hand/foot syndrome--but really pretty manageable.I then did rads and was put on arimidex but since I had such knee pain, got switched to Aromasin.
Posts.Title: adjuvant chemo after neoadjuvant debbiedoes debbiedoes

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 07:32PM - edited May 20, 2011 07:34PM by thePuppetLady I'm on Navelbine....about half-way thru this chemo regimen....2 weeks on, one week off.  I have a weekly infusion of Navelbine and am also taking Xeloda.  So far, no probs with it--the xeloda is a bit troublesome with the hand/foot syndrome--and Onco told me my hair may thin with Navelbine but don't think it has....ellen oh, my apologies, didn't notice this was a stage IV forum but wanted to reply to the query :)
